title: Signal Report — Holiday flagship window (Nov 12 1219 Thanksgiving)
highlights: High-value window: concentrate high-ticket offers and priority inventory from Nov 12 through Thanksgiving.
Test targets: design to detect 10–15% foot-traffic lift and a 5–10 percentage-point rise in early-deal share versus last year.
Immediate 30-day tasks: lock inventory, schedule staffed activations at flagships, and instrument weekly conversion, AOV and footfall.
executive_summary: Focus promotional weight the week of Nov 12 through Thanksgiving to capture compressed holiday spend and validate lift within an 8-week review window [^3][^4]. Design the in-store test to detect a 10–15% foot-traffic uplift versus baseline at flagged flagship locations tied to parade and Thanksgiving timing [^1][^5]. Set a test target to shift early-deal share roughly 5–10 percentage points above last year as shoppers move purchase intent earlier in the season [^3]. Over the next 30 days merch, store ops and analytics must lock priority inventory for high-ticket SKUs, finalize staffed activation and placement plans, and instrument weekly conversion, AOV and footfall metrics to run both the 6-week AI-segmented discount pilot and the broader 6–8 week verification plan [^3][^4][^8].
top_operator_moves: Lock priority inventory for high-ticket SKUs for the Nov 121219 window and set an 8-week verification cadence.
Execute staffed in-store activations at flagship locations tied to parade/Thanksgiving timing and measure store-level footfall and same-store sales.
Run a 6-week AI-segmented discount pilot across 3 stores, tracking markdown depth, redemption rates and margin versus a control group.
